# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia function wrap_string(text::String; text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text, " ")
    lines = String[]
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, line)
            line = String(word)
        else
            line *= " $(word) "
        end
    end
    push!(lines, line)
    join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example
wrap_string("This is a very very very long string that needs to be wrapped at a width of 10 characters")
```

This `wrap_string` function accepts a `text` string as an argument with a default maximum width of 10 characters. The function splits the input string into words, then iterates through each word, checking if the current line length would exceed the maximum width. If so, it adds the current line to a list of lines and starts a new line with the current word. Once all words have been processed, the function returns a joined string of all the lines, with a newline character in between each line.
